content:
Previous Work (cont’d)

  • TWIG [4]: Specifies target-machine as a tree-translation scheme.

    • Does not contain structural information.
    • Does not capture parallelism available in the machine.

    References:
      [1] G. Hadjiyiannis, S. Hanono, and S. Devadas. ISDL: An Instruction Set Description Language for Retargetability. In Proceedings of the 1997 Design Automation Conference, June 1997.

      [2] M. Freericks. The nML Machine Description Formalism. Technical Report,
      TU Berlin Computer Science, 1993
      [3] P. Marwedel. The MIMOLA Design System: Tools for the Design of Digital Processors.
      In Proceedings of the 21st Design Automation Conference, pages 587-593, 1984.
      [4] A.V. Aho, M. Ganapathi and S.W.K. Tjiang. Code Generation Using Tree matching and Dynamic Programming. In Transactions on Programming Languages and Systems, Vol.11, Num. 4, October 1989.
